ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: The most important readings in film studies (painfully selected, with inevitable tragic omissions) and the most important films (painfully selected, with inevitable tragic omissions) covered in one semester.

Each week a member of the Film Studies faculty introduces a number of texts integral to an important issue in film theory. This is then followed by a seminar discussion among graduate students. I would recommend the course to a student wishing to have a comprehensive survey of film theory.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The course introduced me to a number of theoretical schools of thought that I had not yet encountered in my research.
This is a required class to prepare film studies PhDs for the canon exam. It was quite helpful in this, however, please see my comments above.
